intro: Aframmi longiradiatum, commonly known as the long-seed cowpea, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit, palmately lobed leaves, and small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a elongated, cylindrical capsule that contains numerous small, flat seeds. It is often grown as a cover crop due to its ability to suppress weeds and improve soil structure.
